item.title: AVAudioRecorder With OpenEars
item.dc:creator: dingua
item.description:
Hi all,

as i read in the forum ,normally the response it is no.
But i ask it , may be i can find a solution with you:
Can i use AvAudioRecorder to record what is said by user at the same time of the voice recognition process?
If not , there is another alternative?

item.title: Reply To: AVAudioRecorder With OpenEars
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: Basically, the situation with this is that there is one microphone (in most devices), so there is one stream of samples, and OpenEars’ RemoteIO driver is consuming them. So they aren’t available for something else (like an AVAudioRecorder) to consume.

item.title: Reply To: AVAudioRecorder With OpenEars
item.dc:creator: dingua
item.description:
Thanks for responding;
And ther is no solution to get recorded data which openears use to make recognition process?

item.title: Reply To: AVAudioRecorder With OpenEars
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: None that are part of the basic functionality of the framework as supported here, sorry.

item.title: Reply To: AVAudioRecorder With OpenEars
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: To update, you could now do this using the SaveThatWave plugin.
